sentences.english: He spoke out against the excesses of King Edward II.
sentences.chinese: 他公然反對國王愛德華二世的暴政。

sentences.english: The humiliating grip of corruption and tyranny is being pried open.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗和暴政的恥辱枷鎖已被打開。

sentences.english: Opposing tyranny, he led a poor life, and was very miserable in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 由於反抗暴政，他過得很窮苦，晚境淒涼。

sentences.english: We were the first, in this ancient island, to draw the sword against tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 在這個歷史悠久的島上，我們首先拔劍反抗暴政。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there lived a despicable king who was known for his despotism.
sentences.chinese: 從前，有一個卑鄙的國王，以其暴政二臭名昭著。

sentences.english: And above all, no animal must ever tyrannise over his own kind.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，所有的動物都不得向同類施暴政。

sentences.english: Join us to fight against the tyranny of the Connies.
sentences.chinese: 加入我們對抗的康奈斯暴政。

sentences.english: The king domineers over his people.
sentences.chinese: 那個國王對其人民實行暴政。

sentences.english: The people rose, casting off the chains of unjust rule.
sentences.chinese: 人民擺脫了暴政的枷鎖，站起來了。

sentences.english: Knowledge like this gives one great strength in time of oppression or tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的認識在壓迫和暴政時期給人巨大的力量。

sentences.english: It brutalizes its people and denies them their liberty.
sentences.chinese: 它對人民施以暴政，剝奪他們的自由權利。

sentences.english: I do think, however, that tyranny requires an environment of collusion.
sentences.chinese: 但是我也認爲，暴政需要幫兇才能成事。

sentences.english: The vulgarest tool that Tyranny could want.
sentences.chinese: 暴政所需的工具，最粗劣鄙陋。

sentences.english: In the face of tyranny, a band of patriots brought an empire to its knees.
sentences.chinese: 面對暴政，一大批愛國志士曾迫使一個帝國屈膝。

sentences.english: People will re-member the tyrannies of his reign.
sentences.chinese: 人民將永遠不會忘記他的暴政。
阿斯莫德邪惡力量，支配，暴政。

definition: to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
